meanings.definition: A volatile liquid used as an inhalation anesthetic.
meanings.sent1: The doctor carefully administered halothane to the patient before surgery.
meanings.sent2: The hospital stored bottles of halothane for use in operations.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy clown accidentally sprayed halothane instead of water from his flower.
meanings.sent4: The mist of halothane enveloped the room, calming everyone inside.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of halothane filled the air, signaling the start of the procedure.

meanings.definition: To administer halothane as an anesthetic.
meanings.sent1: The anesthesiologist will halothane the patient to induce unconsciousness.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often halothane patients before major surgeries.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to halothane the audience to make them fall asleep with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent4: She halothaned the room, making it a dreamlike space for the surgery.
meanings.sent5: The nurse gently halothaned the child, easing them into a peaceful slumber.

meanings.definition: A chemical compound used in medical procedures.
meanings.sent1: The hospital purchased a new batch of halothane for upcoming surgeries.
meanings.sent2: Halothane is a common choice for anesthetics in many hospitals.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly added halothane instead of salt to the dish, creating a strange flavor.
meanings.sent4: The vial of halothane glinted under the bright lights of the operating room.
meanings.sent5: The clear liquid of halothane sparkled in the syringe, ready for use in the procedure.
